channel.title: Projects on Paul Schumacher
channel.description: Recent content in Teaching on Paul Schumacher

item.title: Introduction to Python for Economists
item.description: In Summer 2023, I introduced several rotations of incoming UCLA students to Python with a focus on data analysis through a hands-on approach. Of over 120 students from 4 continents, I taught a 26-student cohort remotely in daily two-hour tutorials covering Numerical Programming, Data Manipulation, Plotting/Visualization, and Data Analysis. My supervisor for this program was Dr. Randall R. Rojas.

item.title: Winter Quarter 2023
item.description: TThis course is part of the Master's degree program in Quantitative Economics at UCLA. As a former student of this class during my second year, I conducted weekly one-hour tutorials for first-year students. The course integrates financial concepts, such as portfolio theory, with statistical concepts, such as advanced probability and Time Series Analysis. The course and the lectures were instructed by Prof. Zhipeng Liao.
